    "content": "# Business Operations

## Overview

The Business Operations team ensures Hypernet runs efficiently and effectively across all operational functions. This team manages finance, accounting, human resources, legal compliance, facilities, IT operations, and business systems. Business Operations provides the infrastructure and processes that enable other teams to focus on growth, product development, and customer success. As Hypernet scales from startup to market leader, Business Operations evolves from foundational support to strategic enablement.

## Role and Responsibilities

### Finance and Accounting
- Financial planning and analysis (FP&A): budgeting, forecasting, variance analysis
- Manage accounts payable, accounts receivable, and cash flow
- Monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting for management and board
- Investor reporting and fundraising financial support
- Tax compliance (federal, state, international)
- Audit coordination (annual financial audits)
- Financial systems management (QuickBooks, NetSuite, accounting software)

### Human Resources and People Operations
- Recruiting and talent acquisition across all departments
- Onboarding and offboarding processes
- Employee benefits administration (health insurance, 401k, equity)
- Performance management and review cycles
- Compensation benchmarking and equity management
- Employee engagement, culture programs, and retention initiatives
- HR compliance (employment law, workplace safety, harassment prevention)
- People analytics and reporting

### Legal and Compliance
- Contract review and negotiation (customer, vendor, partner, employee)
- Corporate governance and board meeting support
- Privacy law compliance (GDPR, CCPA, emerging regulations)
- Employment law and HR legal matters
- Intellectual property protection (trademarks, patents, copyrights)
- Regulatory compliance monitoring and reporting
- Litigation management (if needed)
- Legal operations and vendor management

### Business Systems and IT Operations
- Internal IT infrastructure and support (laptops, software, networks)
- Business systems implementation (CRM, ERP, HR systems, collaboration tools)
- Data analytics and business intelligence platforms
- IT security for corporate systems (separate from product security)
- Vendor management and procurement
- Software licensing and SaaS management
- IT helpdesk and employee support

### Facilities and Office Management
- Office space planning and management (leases, expansions)
- Workplace experience (office amenities, events, supplies)
- Remote work infrastructure and policies
- Travel and expense management
- Office safety and security
- Vendor relationships (cleaning, catering, office services)

### Business Intelligence and Analytics
- Company-wide metrics and KPI dashboards
- Revenue analytics and reporting
- Operational efficiency analysis
- Data infrastructure for business reporting
- Board reporting and presentation preparation
- Cross-functional analytics support

## Planned Positions and Roles

### Phase 1: Private Beta (Mar-May 2026, Team: 2-3)

**Founder/CEO** (Current)
- Acts as interim CFO and head of operations
- Manages finances, fundraising, legal
- Makes hiring decisions and coordinates HR
- Reports to: Board of Directors

**Operations Coordinator (Contract)** (Month 1-3)
- Administrative support for CEO
- Basic accounting and bookkeeping
- Coordinate onboarding for new hires
- Manage office supplies and vendors
- Reports to: CEO

**Recruiter (Contract)** (Month 2-6)
- Source and recruit engineering talent
- Coordinate interview process
- Support hiring for Series Seed expansion
- Part-time or contract basis
- Reports to: CEO

**External Partners:**
- Accounting firm (bookkeeping, tax prep)
- Law firm (incorporation, contracts, fundraising)
- HR/benefits broker
- Payroll provider (Gusto, Rippling, etc.)

### Phase 2: Public Beta (Jun-Dec 2026, Team: 6-10)

**CFO (Contract/Part-time)** (Month 6-9)
- Financial planning and analysis
- Budgeting and resource allocation
- Investor reporting and fundraising support
- Oversee accounting operations
- Reports to: CEO

**Finance Manager** (Month 8-12)
- Day-to-day accounting operations
- Accounts payable and receivable
- Monthly close and financial reporting
- Manage external accounting firm relationship
- Reports to: CFO or CEO

**HR Manager/People Operations** (Month 7-10)
- Recruiting coordination and hiring
- Onboarding and benefits administration
- Employee relations and engagement
- HR compliance and policies
- Reports to: CEO or COO (if hired)

**Business Operations Manager** (Month 9-12)
- Internal systems and tools
- Vendor management and procurement
- Office management (if applicable)
- IT support coordination
- Reports to: CEO or CFO

**Recruiters (1-2)** (Month 6-12)
- Full-time recruiting for rapid growth
- Source engineering, product, sales, marketing talent
- Manage recruiting pipeline
- Coordinate with hiring managers
- Reports to: HR Manager

**Executive Assistant to CEO** (Month 8-12)
- Calendar and meeting coordination
- Board meeting preparation
- Travel and expense management
- Special projects support
- Reports to: CEO

### Phase 3: Growth (2027, Team: 15-25)

**CFO (Full-time)** (Q1 2027)
- Transition from part-time to full-time executive
- Build finance and accounting team (3-6 people)
- Lead Series A and Series B fundraising
- Strategic financial planning
- M&A financial evaluation
- Reports to: CEO

**Finance Team (3-6)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **Controller** (Q1 2027): Financial reporting, accounting operations, audits
- **Financial Analyst** (Q2 2027): FP&A, modeling, budgeting
- **Accounts Payable/Receivable Specialist** (Q2 2027): AR/AP operations
- **Revenue Operations Analyst** (Q3 2027): Revenue recognition, SaaS metrics, billing
- **Finance Manager** (continues): Accounting operations lead
- Reports to: CFO or Controller

**General Counsel** (Q3-Q4 2027)
- Legal strategy and compliance
- Contract negotiation and review
- Privacy law expertise
- Employment law and HR legal
- Intellectual property
- Reports to: CEO

**Legal Team (1-2)** (Q4 2027)
- **Paralegal** or **Legal Operations Manager**: Contract management, corporate governance support
- Reports to: General Counsel

**VP of People / Head of HR** (Q2-Q3 2027)
- Lead people operations and culture
- Recruiting strategy and team building
- Compensation and equity planning
- Employee engagement and retention
- Performance management systems
- Reports to: CEO or COO

**HR Team (4-8)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **HR Business Partners (2-3)**: Support specific departments (Engineering, Sales, etc.)
- **Recruiters (2-3)**: Technical recruiting, non-technical recruiting, sourcing
- **People Operations Manager**: Benefits, payroll, HRIS, compliance
- **Learning & Development Specialist** (Q4 2027): Training, onboarding programs
- Reports to: VP of People

**IT Operations (2-3)** (Q2-Q4 2027)
- **IT Manager**: Internal IT infrastructure, security, support
- **IT Support Specialist (1-2)**: Helpdesk, device management, employee support
- Reports to: Business Operations Manager or CTO

**Business Operations (2-4)** (Q1-Q4 2027)
- **Business Systems Analyst**: CRM, ERP, analytics platforms
- **Procurement Manager**: Vendor management, purchasing
- **Office Manager** (if office space): Facilities, workplace experience
- Reports to: COO (if hired) or CFO

### Phase 4: Market Leadership (2028, Team: 30-50)

**Chief Operating Officer (COO)** (H1 2028)
- Overall operational leadership
- Manage Business Operations, HR, Legal, Facilities
- Process improvement and efficiency
- International expansion operations
- Reports to: CEO

**CFO** (Continues)
- Finance team leadership (8-12 people)
- Financial planning for IPO
- Treasury management
- Investor relations capability
- Reports to: CEO

**Finance Team (8-12)**
- Controller
- Financial Planning & Analysis team (2-3)
- Accounting team (3-4)
- Revenue Operations team (2-3)

**General Counsel** (Continues)
- Legal team leadership (3-5 people)
- Corporate governance and board support
- Global compliance and regulatory
- M&A legal support
- Reports to: CEO

**Legal Team (3-5)**
- Corporate Counsel (contracts, commercial)
- Privacy Counsel (GDPR, data protection)
- Employment Counsel
- Paralegal / Legal Operations (1-2)

**VP of People / Chief People Officer** (Continues)
- HR team leadership (10-15 people)
- Global HR strategy
- Diversity, equity, inclusion programs
- Executive compensation
- Reports to: CEO or COO

**HR Team (10-15)**
- HR Business Partners (4-6)
- Recruiting team (4-6): Technical, non-technical, sourcing, recruiting ops
- People Operations (2-3): Benefits, payroll, HRIS
- Learning & Development (1-2)
- Employee engagement specialist

**IT and Business Systems (5-8)**
- IT Manager
- IT Support Specialists (2-3)
- Business Systems Analysts (2-3)
- Data Analyst / BI team (1-2)

**Facilities and Workplace (2-4)**
- Facilities Manager
- Office Managers (if multiple offices)
- Workplace Experience Coordinators

## Hiring Timeline and Fundraising Phases

### Phase 1: Seed (Mar-May 2026)
- **Funding:** Self-funded or small angel round
- **Hires:** Operations Coordinator (contract), Recruiter (contract)
- **Total Ops Team:** 2-3 people (mostly contract/part-time)
- **Focus:** Basic finance, accounting, hiring support

### Phase 2: Series Seed (Jun-Dec 2026)
- **Funding:** $20M Series Seed
- **Hires:** CF
